reviews.title: Watch out for this!
reviews.text: The impression we had was that space was at a premium. Although the hotel has lush gardens, much of the area is taken up with bungalows and other accomodation. The pool has a sun area, but because one of the restaurant windows sit close to the edge of it, the feeling is similar to swimming in a goldfish bowl.

reviews.title: Bad from the start
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at the Miramar and that was one night too many. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out the service was poor. Do not expect to get anything that comes with the "Romance Package" unless you ask for it! Skip the hotel restraunts. There are plenty of restraunts close by. Seven days after checking out our credit card statement arrived....we had been double charged for our entire visit. We are still waiting for thier respose.

reviews.title: Simply The Best!
reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous. The gardens are lush and tropical, the views are fantastic and the food is so tasty. The service is impecible and the free valet service is a nice touch, although we tipped, as you should.

reviews.title: Great hotel, just
reviews.text: My fiance is the most descriminating traveller and he loved it. Room cleanliness was above par and the bed was the most comfortable sleep I've had in years. The duvets are a nice touch and is cleaned daily. The decor is quite nice and the outdoor pool grounds were just awesome. The spa was a great amenity and the ladies that provided our treatments were just the best.
We've booked another trip for late August 2006 and can't wait to return. If you have pets, the hotel is dog-friendly and cater to the animals just as they do their two-legged guests.

Although there maybe more luxurious hotels in Santa Monica, none are better located than the Fairmont Miramar. Situated on the corner of Ocean Ave. & Wilshire Blvd., the hotel is right across from the ocean and a block away from the Third St. Promenade yet further away from the seedier element of Santa Monica where some of the more luxurious hotels are located.

reviews.text: My wife and I spent our wedding night in a bungalow at the Fairmont Miramar. (Bill Clinton always stayed in a 2-story bungalow at this hotel when he visited Los Angeles.)

reviews.title: Beautiful place in Santa Monica
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Fairmont at the end of our California vacation in Mid-September 2006. I chose the hotel because of the view and it did not dissappoint. It's nice to actually see the ocean when staying in a seaside location (and this hotel is definitely more affordable than a number of others that have a view). The location of the hotel is not directly on the beach (you have to cross a major street and the Pacific Coast Highway to reach the beach), however, the view of the beach is great. I was aware of this before I made my reservations (having been in Santa Monica prior to this trip). We had a room on the 10th floor of the tower - with a balcony. The room was beautifully furnished and a nice size. Beautiful bathroom, also. The bed was very comfortable. Pool is a good size and the water is warm. Koi pond by the outside bar area is a nice touch.

The only gripe we had was that the bedside reading lamp would only work if we unplugged something else, and we had to get behind the headboard to do that. It looked like a very large selection of items in the minibar. All in all - we enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont very much.
